snippet: All 10 horses in the season-ending National Thoroughbred Racing Association poll for premier 3-year-olds remain in training and are expected to race this year, setting up several appealing events.
abstract: Steve Coburn and Perry Martin, owners of 2014 Kentucky Derby and Preakness Stakes winner California Chrome, have decided against retiring him, hoping that another successful year will help energize the sport; other decorated thoroughbreds are following suit.
lead_paragraph: All 10 horses in the season-ending National Thoroughbred Racing Association poll for premier 3-year-olds remain in training and are expected to race this year, setting up several appealing events.

headline.seo: California Chrome and Other High Achievers Return to the Racetrack
headline.main: Elite Horses Keep Going, and Fans Are Set to Follow
headline.print_headline: Champs Keep Going; Fans Are Set to Follow
